notes: UL = Tolerable Upper Intake Level (typical safety ceiling for chronic daily intake).
UL generally applies to TOTAL intake (food + supplements) unless explicitly noted.
Some nutrients have no established UL; Veda should treat them as 'no_ul' and focus on overlap/waste instead.

upper_limits.label: Vitamin A
notes: UL mainly concerns preformed vitamin A (retinol) rather than beta-carotene.

upper_limits.label: Vitamin C
notes: High intakes may cause GI upset in some users.

upper_limits.label: Vitamin E
notes: Fat-soluble; higher risk if stacked across multiple supplements.

upper_limits.label: Vitamin K
notes: No established UL; focus on medication interactions (e.g., anticoagulants).

upper_limits.label: B1 (Thiamine)
notes: No established UL.

upper_limits.label: B2 (Riboflavin)
notes: No established UL.

upper_limits.label: B3 (Niacin)
notes: UL mainly relates to supplemental niacin; flushing risk.

upper_limits.label: B5 (Pantothenic acid)
notes: No established UL.

upper_limits.label: B6
notes: Chronic high intakes may be associated with neuropathy risk.

upper_limits.label: B7 (Biotin)
notes: No established UL; can interfere with some lab tests.

upper_limits.label: B9 (Folate)
notes: UL applies to folic acid (supplements/fortified foods), not naturally occurring folate.

upper_limits.label: B12
notes: No established UL.

upper_limits.label: Calcium
notes: Watch stacking from multis + dedicated calcium + fortified foods.

upper_limits.label: Magnesium
notes: UL is for supplemental magnesium (not food magnesium). GI side effects often appear earlier.

upper_limits.label: Potassium
notes: No established UL for healthy adults; supplements are often dose-limited in many markets.

upper_limits.label: Sodium
notes: Treat as a daily limit/ceiling rather than a target.

upper_limits.label: Iron
notes: High-risk stacking nutrient; only escalate messaging if clearly above UL or multiple iron sources.

upper_limits.label: Zinc
notes: Chronic high zinc can impair copper status; flag zinc+copper imbalance patterns.

upper_limits.label: Copper
notes: Usually only an issue with high-dose supplements.

upper_limits.label: Iodine
notes: Thyroid-sensitive; watch kelp/seaweed supplements.

upper_limits.label: Selenium
notes: Narrow safety margin; common stacking via multis + selenium-only products.

upper_limits.label: Phosphorus
notes: Usually abundant from food; rarely needed as a supplement.

upper_limits.label: Manganese
notes: Watch high-dose 'trace mineral' blends.

upper_limits.label: Chromium
notes: No established UL.

upper_limits.label: Molybdenum
notes: Usually only an issue with high-dose supplements.
